title: Create Concept Art and Visual Development
purpose: Describe the core function Create Concept Art and Visual Development.
guardrails: All concept art should remain exploratory and clearly marked as non‑final
Avoid using copyrighted or trademarked imagery without proper authorization
Maintain consistency with the established tone and visual language from the mood board and beat sheet
Provide variety in concepts while staying within defined world constraints and themes
Document references and influences properly and maintain clear attribution
Keep file sizes manageable and organized for easy review and archiving
Do not overspend time on high‑fidelity rendering; focus on breadth of exploration
Complete all tasks within the R&D timeframe and leave time for feedback cycles

tasks.title: Review premise, beat sheet, and mood board, and script
tasks.description: Execute the task: Review premise, beat sheet, and mood board, and script.

deliverables.description: Notes summarizing key themes, art directions and visual goals distilled from the premise, beat sheet, mood board and script.

acceptance.text: Captures essential tone, themes and visual goals.
Reflects consensus from the creative team.
Organized by topic such as characters, environments and props.

tasks.title: Research visual styles and gather references
tasks.description: Execute the task: Research visual styles and gather references.

deliverables.description: A collection of curated reference images categorized by visual style, character, environment and mood.

acceptance.text: Contains organized folders for characters, environments, props and colour schemes.
Each reference is tagged with context and story beat.
Includes a manifest describing the contents.

tasks.title: Sketch initial concept art for principal characters
tasks.description: Execute the task: Sketch initial concept art for principal characters.

deliverables.description: Early concept sketches exploring visual possibilities for principal characters.

acceptance.text: Includes multiple concept sketches per principal character.
Annotates design rationale for major visual decisions.
Reflects narrative and personality descriptions.

tasks.title: Design environments and key locations with rough paintings
tasks.description: Execute the task: Design environments and key locations with rough paintings.

deliverables.description: Rough paintings and sketches illustrating key locations and environments in the story.

acceptance.text: Depicts major locations with composition and mood cues.
Annotations indicate scene context and design considerations.
Ties back to narrative beats and visual themes.

tasks.title: Develop prop and costume designs
tasks.description: Execute the task: Develop prop and costume designs.

deliverables.description: Design sheets showcasing props and costumes for characters across different scenes.

acceptance.text: Includes detailed drawings of props and costumes with notes on scale and materials.
Shows variations where appropriate.
Aligns with character and world guidelines.

tasks.title: Define color palettes and lighting schemes
tasks.description: Execute the task: Define color palettes and lighting schemes.

deliverables.description: Color scripts presenting color palettes and lighting schemes across sequences, highlighting mood and progression.

acceptance.text: Each script contains panels showing color progression across a sequence.
Includes palette swatches and lighting notes for each panel.
Corresponds to narrative arcs and emotional beats.

tasks.title: Build the style guid
tasks.description: Execute the task: Build the style guid.

deliverables.description: A comprehensive visual development PDF combining character, environment, prop art and colour scripts into a cohesive style guide.

acceptance.text: Integrates all visual elements into a consistent narrative and style.
Defines final colour palette, line weights and textures for production art.
Serves as the reference for all downstream production work.
